alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 08 at 2:15PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Small streams and creeks will experience higher flows due to snowmelt across Humboldt County... Warm temperatures and high elevation snowpack will lead to an increase in snowmelt across portions of Humboldt county this weekend. With high temperatures rising into the 60s today and the 70s by Sunday, the spring melt will be in full swing. As a result, increased runoff will be seen in some of the streams and creeks in Humboldt county, like Martin Creek in Paradise Valley, McDermitt Creek near McDermitt, and the Quinn River near McDermitt are all registering higher than normal flows on USGS river gages. The streams will continue to flow as runoff increases. No flooding is anticipated at this time, though outdoor enthusiasts should use caution as the water is very cold and a person could be swept away by the fast flowing water.
